The Department of Education and Skills (DES) is responsible for developing Information and Communications Technology (ICT) in schools
Tá an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna (DES) freagrach as Teicneolaíocht Faisnéise agus Cumarsáide (TFC) i scoileanna a fhorbairt
It aims to help teachers to incorporate ICT into their skill sets and teaching practice, and to develop curriculum and learning resources that make use of ICT
Tá sé mar chuspóir cabhrú le múinteoirí chun TFC a ionchorprú isteach ina sraitheanna scileanna agus cleachtas múinteoireachta, agus chun acmhainní curaclaim agus foghlama a fhorbairt a úsáideann TFC
This document outlines the strategies and programmes in place to achieve these aims
Tugtar breac-chuntas sa cháipéis seo ar na straitéisí agus na cláir atá i bhfeidhm chun na cuspóirí seo a bhaint amach
Most of these programmes are operated and managed by the Professional Development Service for Teachers (PDST)
Déanann an tSeirbhís um Fhorbairt Ghairmiúil do Mhúinteoirí (PDST) mórchuid na gclár seo a fheidhmiú agus a bhainistiú
Professional Development Service for Teachers (PDST)
An tSeirbhís um Fhorbairt Ghairmiúil do Mhúinteoirí (PDST)
From 1st June 2012, the role and functions of the National Centre for Technology in Education (NCTE) come under the remit of the Professional Development Service for Teachers
Ón 1 Meitheamh 2012, tagann feidhmeanna agus ról an Lárionaid Náisiúnta do Theicneolaíocht san Oideachas (NCTE) faoi chuimsiú na Seirbhíse um Fhorbairt Ghairmiúil do Mhúinteoirí
The PDST provides advice and support to the Department and other bodies on the development and use of ICT in education
Cuireann an PDST comhairle agus tacaíocht ar fáil don Roinn agus do chomhlachtaí eile ar fhorbairt agus úsáid TFC san oideachas
It also provides a number of ICT support services to schools through:
Ina theannta sin, cuireann siad roinnt seirbhísí tacaíochta TFC ar fáil do scoileanna tríd an méid a leanas:
• Designing and implementing a series of in-career ICT training programmes for teachers
• Sraith cláir inghairme oiliúna TFC a dhearadh agus a chur i bhfeidhm do mhúinteoirí
• Developing and maintaining ScoilNet - an online educational portal. It has also responsibility for the development of other websites with specific relevance to the curriculum
• ScoilNet a fhorbairt agus a chothabháil – tairseach oideachasúil ar líne Ina theannta sin, tá siad freagrach as forbairt láithreán gréasáin eile ag a bhfuil baint ar leith leis an gcuraclam
• Supporting and facilitating school leadership in e-learning planning
• Ceannaireacht scoile a éascú agus tacú léi i bpleanáil ríomhfhoghlama
• Supporting the innovative use and integration of ICT in schools through pilot projects
• Tacú le húsáid agus comhtháthú nuálaíoch TFC i scoileanna trí thionscadail phíolótacha
• Providing a general ICT advice service to schools
• Seirbhís ghinearálta chomhairle TFC a chur ar fáil do scoileanna
PDST is responsible for coordinating the Schools Broadband Programme
Tá an PDST freagrach as an gClár leathanbhanda le haghaidh Scoileanna a chomhordú
This provides integrated services, including broadband connectivity, and hosted services, such as content filtering, web hosting-blogging and security services
Cuireann seo seirbhís chomhtháite ar fáil, lena n-áirítear nascacht leathanbhanda, agus seirbhísí óstáilte, ar nós scagadh ábhair, óstáil-blagáil gréasáin agus seirbhísí slándála
These services are managed by the Schools Broadband Team which includes the PDST, the Department and HEAnet
Déanann Foireann Leathanbhanda na Scoileanna a áiríonn an PDST, an Roinn agus HEAnet na seirbhísí seo a bhainistiú
PDST also manages the Broadband Service Desk
Ina theannta sin, bainistíonn an PDST Deasc Seirbhíse Leathanbhanda
This is a single point of contact for schools for all broadband related issues
Pointe singil teagmhála é seo do scoileanna do gach saincheist leathanbhanda chomhghaolmhar
PDST is responsible for managing and developing internet safety programmes and subject modules, and advising on the development and use of Acceptable Use Policies (AUPs) in schools

Tá an PDST freagrach as bainistiú agus forbairt a dhéanamh ar chláir shábháilteachta idirlín agus modúil ábhair, agus comhairle a thabhairt ar fhorbairt agus ar úsáid Polasaithe Úsáide Inghlachta (AUPanna) i scoileanna
Webwise, the Irish Safer Internet Centre promotes the safe, responsible use of the internet and mobile devices by children and young people
Cuireann Webwise, Lárionad Idirlín Níos Sábháilte na hÉireann úsáid shábháilte, fhreagrach fearais idirlín agus shoghluaiste chun cinn i measc leanaí agus ógánach
It is co-funded by the European Union Safer Internet Programme and the Department
Tá sé comhchistithe ag Clár Idirlín Níos Sábháilte an Aontais Eorpaigh agus ag an Roinn
Special education and ICT
Oideachas speisialta agus TFC
PDST provides advice relating to the use of technology with students who have special educational needs
Cuireann an PDST comhairle ar fáil maidir le húsáid teicneolaíochta le daltaí ag a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais
Department of Education and Skills also provide assistive technology grants for individual students with special educational needs
Sa bhreis air sin, cuireann an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna deontais teicneolaíochta cúnta ar fáil do dhaltaí aonair ag a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais
Applications for this funding must be made by the local Special Educational Needs Organiser (SENO)
Ní mór don Eagraí Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais (SENO) áitiúil iarratais a dhéanamh ar an gcistiú
ICT in Schools Programme
An Clár TFC i Scoileanna
The ICT in Schools Programme began in 1998
Cuireadh tús leis an gClár TFC i Scoileanna i 1998
NCTE was set up by the Department of Education and Skills to manage the Schools IT2000 initiative and to provide support to first and second level schools integrating ICT into learning and teaching

Bunaíodh an NCTE ag an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna chun Tionscnamh scoileanna IT2000 a bhainistiú agus chun tacaíocht a chur ar fáil do scoileanna chéad agus dara leibhéal agus TFC á chomhtháthú acu san fhoghlaim agus sa teagasc
In 2008, the Department published 2 reports on ICT in schools
In 2008, d’fhoilsigh an Roinn 2 thuarascáil ar TFC i scoileanna
Investing Effectively in Information and Communications Technology in Schools 2008-2013 is the report of the strategy group appointed to advise on priorities for investment in ICT in schools

Is í Innfheistíocht Éifeachtach a dhéanamh i dTeicneolaíocht Faisnéise agus Cumarsáide i Scoileanna 2008-2013 (Investing Effectively in Information and Communications Technology in Schools 2008-2013) tuarascáil an ghrúpa straitéise a ceapadh le comhairle a chur ar na tosaíochtaí d’infheisíocht i TFC i scoileanna
ICT in Schools is an evaluation on the impact of ICT on teaching and learning which was done by the Department’s Inspectorate
Is measúnú TFC i Scoileanna ar thionchar TFC ar theagasc agus ar fhoghlaim a rinne Stiúrthóireacht na Roinne
In 2009, the Smart Schools = Smart Economy (pdf) report was published by the Joint Advisory Group
In 2009, d’fhoilsigh an Comhghrúpa Comhairleach an tuarascáil Smart Schools = Smart Economy (pdf)
This Group was appointed by the then Minister to work with industry to explore possible approaches to implementing the recommendations of the 2008 Strategy Group Report
Cheap an tAire um an dtaca sin an Grúpa seo chun oibriú leis an tionscal chun cur chuige féideartha a fhiosrú maidir le moltaí Thuarascáil Ghrúpa Straitéise 2008 a chur i bhfeidhm
Equipment grants have also been provided to schools under this programme
Ina theannta sin, cuireadh deontais trealaimh ar fáil do scoileanna faoin gclár seo
